boardgame.name: Amacao
boardgame.description:
A simple eurogame were you venture the seas to buy goods and try to make the biggest profit out of them.
It is based on the historic Portuguese sea routs on the far east, and the adventures the merchant of that time lived.
It has a great supply and demand mechanic, were the player can interact with the board state and there for with each other.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hounds Tooth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue 3 of Instant Villain!

This PDF contains a full write-up of Hounds Tooth.

Each issue of Instant Villain: Includes full stats, background story, support cast write-up, tactical and plot suggestions.

boardgame.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Druid Circles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF presents two new druid circles for the Amazons vs Valkyries setting.

Circle of Abundance. These druids serve their communities as arborists, farmers, and herbalists. Some specialize in husbandry overseeing the births of cattle and other livestock. Druids of the Circle of Abundance hold a yearly meeting in the Spring to exchange seeds, share herbal remedies for various ailments, and discuss best practices in husbandry.

Circle of Arcana. Some druids specialize in the mystical aspect of nature, dabbling in wizardry, alchemy, and sorcery. Members of the Circle of Arcana study rare elements, unusual species, and metaphysical phenomena. Though they refrain from writing druidic lore, they collect and study books on history, philosophy, and magic. These druids are reclusive and rarely take an interest in outsiders. When they leave their remote sanctuaries to interact with civilians, it is an auspicious sign.

boardgame.name: In The Bluelight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The days are fleeting out on the ice. The days are fleeting everywhere, now, but out on the barrens of Kergüs they are even further lessened. Time is thin here. It stretches, twists, freezes. Shatters.

Miseries grip the world, inevitable and unending. The Doomsayers scream that they can't be stopped, that the end is nigh, that the seventh Misery will come and the world will burn. Verhu's word has never yet been wrong.

And yet.

Yet.

Maybe there is hope out there in the ice, where time rolls like sludge. Where the end is, perhaps, not quite so inevitable.

In The Bluelight takes characters deep beneath the barren wastes of Kergüs, where an ancient artefact that holds the power to stop the Miseries afflicting the world lies buried beneath the ice. There is treasure frozen into the icy walls, too, and if you were to extract it you would return home rich. But the thaw that opened the Ice Vaults will not last forever, and if the characters tally too long they’ll find themselves trapped inside the glacier for the rest of their short, shivering lives.

The adventure itself is a sprawling dungeon over three levels packed full of NPCs, weird encounters, and a subterranean maze haunted by the oozing remnants of a third prophetic basilisk. It comes complete with encounter tables for the long trek across the ice fields of Kergüs, and new scriptures from the Arkhian Theurgy that replace the Calendar of Nechrubel while inside the dungeon, making the ice shift and change as the players spend more time in the Vaults.

The dungeon portion of the book mimics the layout of Rotblack Sludge, the introductory adventure found in MÖRK BORG, so it’s familiar and easy to use at the table.

boardgame.name: The Crystal Tiefling
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Crystal Tiefling is an alternate breed of Tiefling, which holds an echo of one of many planes within them rather than the influence of one of the layers of hell. Tieflings of this nature develop bodies and characteristics that resemble various gemstones and minerals, giving them distinct appearances. They are absurdly rare and blur the line between their own infernal heritage and other planetouched beings. Each innately gains access to magic that embodies the plane that seeds their power, and also the ability to manifest an aspect of those planes for a brief period of time.

Contents
This bundle is meant to introduce the spectacle that is the Crystal Tiefling, as well as offer a variety of options for players who wish to use them, and DMs who wish to include them as NPCs. The content should provide a widely varied experience that can be used to generate dozens of Crystal Tiefling NPCs, as well as options such as subclasses that can be used for characters that aren't Crystal Tieflings. The following are included:

A new base Tiefling race( the Crystal Tiefling)
10 subraces based on the four Elemental Planes, the Positive and Negative Energy Planes, as well as Elysium, Pandemonium, Mechanus, and the Shadowfell.
Ideal, Flaw, Quirk, and Origin tables
12 Crystal Tiefling-specific feats
8 new subclasses for the Barbarian, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Petal Knight, Rogue, Sword Saint, and Warlock.
8 Eldritch Invocations
1 Saint Myth Weapon artifact
7 Crystal Tiefling NPCs
df1xvxa-e80d96e5-23a8-4d48-9054-30f7b40d
Subclasses
The following are basic breakdowns of the subclasses contained within the product, all of which are themed after invoking elemental or planar powers, and are not limited to use with the Crystal Tiefling.

Barbarian - Path of the Whispering Voice
A barbarian who hears whispers upon the winds, and gains their aid in their exploits. Others may see them as savages who whisper to empty air, but they speak to unseen spirits who embody the wind itself. As their familiarity with this unseen ally grows, so too does their power to control the wind and focus in as they wish.
Fighter - Hearthguard
A heroic figure who draws upon an innate control over flame. The fire they conjure is tied to their spirit, and when focused can grant them undying fortitude in combat. Weapons glowing white-hot, they charge through their opposition as heroic or brutal champions.
Monk - Way of the Crystal Hand
The world is made of many folded over one another, with echoes of what we know stretching out into the untold reaches of infinity. These monks train themselves to see through many echoes of the world at once and make use of the mirror worlds they see.
Paladin - Oath of Banishment
Known as Edgekeepers, these paladins take upon themselves the difficult task of protecting their plane from invaders from beyond it. They do so with respect to the natives of others but keep a firm watch over the order between worlds. Their powers allow for banishment and seeing overlapping planes.
Petal Knight - Winecup Epithet
A warrior who excels in subterfuge and dealing with poisons. These duelists can benefit from powers that allow them to become invisible at will, avoid the brunt of the damage from attacks and imbue their weaponry with a natural poison that they inflict on those they strike.
Rogue - Rimeknife
Infused with an icy aspect, these rogues strike surgically at opponents. They drift like ghosts within clouds of fog and snow, cutting into opponents when they least expect it. They can trade amounts of their sneak attack dice to inflict secondary effects upon their target.
Sword Saint - Way of the Snow White Sleeve
There once existed a calming swordswoman who constructed a sword from the heart of a frozen elder water elemental and a fragment of their own soul. Those who follow this path replicate their teachings, focusing on turning their spiritual energy into ice and snow to freeze and slow their enemies.
This document includes their Sword Saint Weapon, the Snow Sleeve, an artifact-rarity longsword with various freezing effects.
Warlock - The Cataclysmic
Forging a pact with an Elder Elemental or similar beast from the Elemental Planes, these Warlocks become agents for these cataclysmic figures. In return they gain a powerful elemental agent they can manifest and command, which grows stronger as they do. At the height of its power, they can merge with their elemental agent and embody the power of their patron directly.
This document includes 8 Eldritch Invocations meant for the Cataclysmic Warlock.

boardgame.name: Maeve's Almanac of Spiritual Phenomena
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maeve’s renown as a master explorer is well-earned: from the spirit-haunted mist enclaves to the soul-draining doldrums, Maeve explored much of the known world and came back to tell the tale.

This supplement explores the environments of fantasy worlds and features five unique phenomena that can fit any 5E game. Aside from new rules and randomization tables that bring the environment to life, the book contains jotted notes written by the esteemed explorer Maeve from the world of Elanor.

Chapter 1, “Ethereal Environments,” features three types of supernatural regions: mist enclaves, memento etherealis, and doldrums.

Chapter 2, “Spiritual Hazards,” presents two types of short-lived phenomena that can appear anywhere in the world: empathy snares and ethereal storms.

boardgame.name: Tavern Tales #1: Lair of the Battle Mage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tavern Tales 1: Lair of the Battle Mage is a stand-alone fantasy RPG adventure complete with maps, room descriptions, NPCs, and general information for a GM to run it using any fantasy RPG game. The adventure is rules-agnostic, meaning it will require some customization by the GM with regards to NPC and creature stats.

The adventure also includes a few handouts that can be printed and provided to players.

Lair of the Battle Mage: The best stories told by Niloshis the Whisperer here at the Dented Helm Tavern seem to always involve a theft. That old half-elf sorcerer has got a never-ending supply of wild tales. The Lair of the Battle Mage, for example… it’s one of my favorites and the one that’s been asked for tonight. Yes, a detail or two will sometimes change, but the heart of the story? That’s always consistent. Here – have a seat. It looks like he’s beginning his tale…

boardgame.name: Pocket Fantasy RPG: Optional Races
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here are 21 Optional Races for your Pocket Fantasy RPG games! The standard races for the main rules are also included for a combined total of 25 races.

boardgame.name: Dark Deeds Along the Old Coach Road: The Silver Egg
The Silver Egg
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for 2nd-level characters.

Raids on nearby farmsteads sends adventurers to Vander’s Heights to root out the goblin bandits.

Their straightforward mission, however, runs headlong into several groups descending into an underground bunker — all vying to control the egg of a silver dragon.

boardgame.name: Dark Deeds Along the Old Coach Road: Goblins Threat and Menace
Goblins: Threat and Menace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Use them — don’t lose them.

This game aid provides a game master with advice on using goblins so they stay fresh from encounter to encounter.

Use them as worg riders, arsonists, silent assassins and fierce spear-wielders. Those are just a few of the many ways goblins can enhance encounters with just some minor tweaks.

boardgame.name: Shadows of a New Dawn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shadows of a New Dawn, a 5th-6th level adventure for Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game, which introduces the Gamemaster and Players to The Galaxy of alien worlds and adventure. Shadows of a New Dawn uses the D10 Pentra System, of which only a 10-sided die is needed to play this RPG adventure.

A humanoid scientist who has spoken out against an insectoid race of people that have ecomically taken over his home planet is assasinated. The characters, caught between this racial turmoil, are tasked with discovering the assassins. What they discover will change the face of a planet forever. So strap on your force screen, grab your laser pistol, concentrate on your Psi, prepare your starship for Hypershot, and blast off from Aphelion’s Gate!
boardgame.rpg: Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: The Tome of Storms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tome of Storms seeks to expand upon The Stormbound for PF1e which I wrote for Cobalt Sage Creations, adding new archetypes, PRCs, and storm powers for the stormbound, a whole suite of new veils, and unofficial errata and reworks to some of the content released in that book!

Also included in this book are new archetypes and class features for a number of other classes based around storm veils and weather!

boardgame.name: Under the Surface
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lost worlds of prehistoric wonder...
Ancient civilizations sunk beneath the waves...
Mythical islands... and tombs of untold horror.
All of this and more awaits the intrepid pulp adventurer!

From the sunken continents of Atlantis and Lemuria to the vast subterranean worlds of Agartha and the Hollow Earth, from the primeval Maple White plateau in South America to the mysterious Noble's Isle in the Pacific, this sourcebook contains a wealth of information for the globetrotting A.E.G.I.S. field agent, treasure hunter, or explorer. 192 pages of location details, maps, creatures, and NPCs to keep your retro pulp adventure campaigns fresh until the end of time!

42 locales - many with built-in story hooks!
64 new npcs - from staunch allies to scheming villains!
44 new vehicles - from cars to planes to submersibles - and some legendary encounters!
8 otherworld artifacts, 25 new weapons, and 78 creatures - from dinosaurs to mermaids, and everything in between!
GM section with rules for underwater combat & survival, new rules for fear & mental stress, and 6 mission briefs!

boardgame.name: Card Solitaire
boardgame.description:
Roll dice and move around the board to buy cards from the deck and earn as many points as possible.

Moving cards from the deck to the board requires the player to land on a space on the outer track. Once a complete row (Either horizontal or vertical) is completed they can be moved to the score position.

The game ends when the deck has depleated and the final score is determined by by the number of face down score position cards.

boardgame.name: Blue Dragon Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #55: Blue Dragon Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the green dragon lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Red Dragon Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #56: Red Dragon Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the green dragon lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Sagitta Stellaris
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Paths of Cosmic Power

Sagitta Stellaris is a new martial discipline for Path of War that focuses on ranged combat, battlefield control, and a dash of fortune-telling. By harnessing the power of the stars, your arrows can draw magical paths around the battlefield in their wake, strengthening allies or hindering enemies who step across them. The style rewards archers who have a broad awareness of positioning in fights to shape the tides in their favor, but also has mechanics to hybridize with martials that invest in offense-focused styles. For those who want to specialize, this booklet offers a creepy gothic archetype for Harbinger, the rosethorn princess, that ensnares enemies in cursed vines. Gunslingers can take the bulletwriter archetype, an artisan that crafts metaphysical bullets from their emotions.

boardgame.name: Sagacity
boardgame.description:
Sagacity is an abstract strategy game where players will compete to core the agreed upon amount of points by connecting a line of four of their own pieces. The twist comes from the game's four tiered board.

Each tier has a clear plastic 5x5 grid. A line of four pieces can connect on a single level or by using all four of levels of the board either vertically, horizontally or diagonally. Each line of four pieces will score a single point. If a player is able to complete two lines of four pieces in a single turn they will score 3 points, and if a player is able to complete three lines of four pieces is a single turn they will automatically win the game.

Similar to Connect Four, players will take turns adding a single piece to any unoccupied space on any of the four tiers. When all pieces have been placed if neither player has won, the pieces are removed and play continues.

boardgame.name: Untold Encounters of the Random Kind
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Untold Encounters of the Random Kind is a tool to generate ideas, encounters and even entire adventures for fantasy RPG Games.
This book is designed to work with your existing RPG system, and we provide a 5E conversion guide in addition to our system agnostic mechanics.
This book contains over 1000 random encounters, 6 mini 5E pre written adventures, adventure generators and is packed full of random tables.
We have broken the book into 3 main chapters –
Town Encounters
Wilderness Encounters
Dungeon Encounters
These chapters are further broken down into sections to allow you to find encounters most relevant to your specific scenario. Of course we also provide roll tables to randomise your choices, or you can simply choose the encounters you like the look of.
Each chapter contains hundreds of relevant random encounters, and also entire Adventure generators so you can roll up an entire campaign should you so wish.
So pick up your dice and roll up an encounter on us!

boardgame.name: Tome of Wondrous Items
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nearly 600 new magical items, spells, monsters, and mystical tattoos for your campaign!

Tome of Wondrous Items — the companion volume to our acclaimed Tome of Alchemy — offers a vast array of resources for creative game mastery. Learn about the fascinating-but-disgusting brain jar, the ring of the smoke wyrm, the terrifying rod of necromancy, the staff of the arch-spider, the wand of runes, and the scepter of the heavens!

What else is lurking inside the Tome of Wondrous Items?

All the Basics: Chapters filled with magical armor, rings, rods, scrolls, staves, wands, wondrous items, and weapons!
Magical Tattoos: As a bonus (and because the author loves his tattoos and skin art in general), the book contains an appendix covering magical tattoos: how to get them, how to use them, and their powers.
Otherworldly Items: Not all magic is of this world. Using otherworldly items often comes at great peril. Normal identification magic yields nothing; the only sure way is a combination of research into dusty tomes and dangerous experimentation. If weird tech items such as golem suits and energy projectors are your thing, you're covered and energized.
New Spells: New spells such as obfuscate nature and suppress item, as well as optional rules for dealing with magical conjunction and panoplies of items!
New Monsters: Some of these wondrous items summon strange things. Be wary of the spell moth!

boardgame.name: Ghosts of Ur
boardgame.description:
The Tabletop board game based on ancient Sumer 3800 - BCE. As one of six adventurers, each with their unique talents, you will fight your way through a vast and unrecognizable land filled with dangers and riches. Your goal is to journey through the landscape of Ancient Sumer and find the 4 City Ziggurats and collect all of the Map Cards (either through purchase, negotiation, or theft) that will lead you to the great City of Ur where you hope to defeat Nanna the God of Ur.

We have high quality pieces such as a Durable, Washable, Foldable Silicone Adventure Board, 6 Hand Casted 32MM Lead free Pewter (paintable) Adventurer's, Tetrahedron Dice, 20 Sided Die, D100 Dice, Cards, Tiles, Burlap Storage bags.

boardgame.name: Diamond Classes: Renowned Warrior and the Peach Tree Oath
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gather great heroes and ride forth! This new supplement for Pathfinder 1st edition from Diamond Recreational Studios features over 12 pages of high-impact content.

Inside this book you'll find:
- The Renowned Warrior prestige class, a 10 level prestige class featuring a choice between one of three paths to walk: the Path of the Imperious Leader, an enabler in the field of battle, the Path of the Loyal Brother, a staunch defender of their allies, and the Path of the Warrior God, a confident warrior which thrives with their own continued success.
- Over 10 warrior prowesses, unique talent-like options for the Renowned Warrior prestige class, from dodging between arrows, to mastering combat as a sightless warrior, to great feats of archery and moving beyond the limitations of a weapon's mystic limitations.
- The Order of the Peach Tree, a new cavalier and samurai order with great weapon wielding, leading others, and becoming a whirling dervish on the battlefield. Members of the order of the peach tree are often idealists which swear oaths of loyalty to the ideal of an individual or cause, rather than the individual specifically.
- Four New Combat Feats for two-handed combat. Strike towards your enemy and cleave through those around you! These new feats are also represented as associated feats as Two Combat Talents for Spheres of Might

boardgame.name: Wig Masters micro
boardgame.description:
Play as the fanciest wig merchants in 18th century France. Buy wigs, sell wigs, and manipulate the ever changing wig market to make the most money and win.
Each turn has 4 phases
Phase 1: players place wigs on the various areas of their
player card to enable actions during subsequent phases.
Phase 2: players can adjust market demand or prices (if they
enabled this ability).
Phase 3: players may sell their wigs to the market for money.
Phase 4: Players may take wig(s) from supply if they enabled
this ability.
This game uses coins as pieces. Not included.
This game is completely different from the original Wig Masters game that is is based on. This game has no element of luck and is decided by pure skill and strategy but is also very light and quick. Version A includes 8 characters, each with a unique special ability. Version B includes 6 characters and the 4 player market board. Combine both versions to play with up to 4 players.

boardgame.name: Freak Show
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A generic Circus Horror, Thriller, Detective adventure.

Beppo – married to Frederica – had an affair with Geena. Gunther (Geena's husband) found out and put a spell (a real magic spell) on Beppo's watch. However – Beppo found out and left the watch in his tent. A customer walks by and sees the watch and steals it. He later explodes during Beppo's show.
This is a generic adventure, created for ANY type of fantasy setting/world. The adventure is written without any rule system in mind. Most RPG rules based in this type of world should be possible to be used.

The setting is a traveling circus with small theme park, where a bizarre murder happens - which the players need to solve.

boardgame.name: Troll Pit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a mysterious cave, darkness whispers secrets to those who dare to listen, and daring adventurers can win divinations and learn the magical secrets of Dark Magicians, but not everyone escapes alive from the Troll Pit, where darkness consumes the careless.

This is a dungeon your magic-users want to explore. It contains magical secrets and gives them access to new powers and new spells. All they need to do is convice the rest of the party to stare into the Abyss.

Troll Pit takes the adventurers to a small dungeon, which tempts them with powerful prophecies and wizards with new powers. It as an adventure suitable for B/X games and retro-clones such as Labyrinth Lords and Old-School Essentials.

The adventure was originally written for the Danish Living Campaign The Hinterlands, and it is for the first time presented in English. The adventure introduces the players to a different tradition of adventures, and it one with a focus on exploration and encountering the unknown.

This adventure contains new monsters, new magical items, new spell and new powers for magic-users, as well as a dungeon they may become a recurring location in your campaign.

The Adventure is for a level 2-4 party or a single character level 5-7.

boardgame.name: Henry: The Agincourt Campaign, 1415
boardgame.description:
In Henry, the fifth game in Volko Ruhnke’s Levy & Campaign Series, players will bring to life all of the drama of the famous Agincourt campaign. Players will lead either the English forces of King Henry V or the French nobility in the levying of forces, management of logistics, and campaigning through Northern France. Designed by Joe Schmidt, Henry aims to create a more streamlined version of Levy & Campaign that is equally suitable for someone’s first experience or a quicker lunchtime gaming session.

The English player will build their army at the outset of the game, and in doing so set their victory conditions based on these choices, and then begin their campaign. While the English march through Normandy, the French Nobles will need to rapidly respond by levying their forces and navigating the internal court politics of their ongoing civil war between the Armagnac and Burgundian factions. Then, once ready for battle, the French will attempt to hunt down and prevent King Hal and his happy few from returning home.

The Levy & Campaign system offers us something more focused on the human element. Humans need to be fed, and that food needs to be both secured and transported. Without that, even the greatest of armies will fail. Henry endeavors to lift the veil of the mythology of the Battle of Agincourt to offer a more detailed look into the circumstances that created the legend.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Not So Fast, Billy Ray!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Of course, everybody knows ol’ Billy Ray.

But now he’s missing, and arcane researchers are being drawn to the sleepy town of Ogallala, Nebraska, by a powerful magical disruption. Perhaps you’re a friend of the simple man, maybe he owes you money, or just maybe you’re a magical sensitive being lured to the town by dreams of power. No matter the reason, Ogallala calls and you aim to answer. Not So Fast, Billy Ray is a module designed for 4-7 level 2 adventurers in the world of Weird Frontiers.

boardgame.name: Dig Three Graves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An open-world investigation set in the weird West of the Weird Frontiers roleplaying game. Dig Three Graves pits the characters against impossible odds and a secret society ripped from actual history. To triumph, the characters will have to rely on far more than just a fast draw or lucky incantation. For when the hoofbeats thunder and the skies darken, it's long past time to sort the quick from the dead. Suitable for characters of 2nd to 3rd level.

boardgame.name: The Front Line: Stalingrad
boardgame.description:
At the end of August the Sixth Army and the Fourth Panzer Army reached the banks of the Don, Hitler ordered them to capture Stalingrad by surrounding it from the north and south with rapid movements of the tanks. Stalin and his lieutenant, General Zhukov, reacted and sent the 62nd and 64th Armies to defend the city.

This is a Roll And Write mechanics game for one player with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

Completing 70 German kills, ends the game and the player wins the game. The Germans (AI) must capture some sectors depending on the difficulty to win.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Malevolent Seven
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seeking resolution to a nightmare which foretells their deaths, the PCs must race against time to gain as many tools as they can to reduce the power of the "Malevolent Seven." Questioning the loclas, confronting ancient mysteries, and even beseeching near-forgotten gods, the trailhands must prepare for one HELL of a showdown.

The Malevolent Seven is a Weird Frontiers adventure designed for a group of 4-6, 3rd level trailhands. It is intended for an established group of adventurers.

boardgame.name: Buried Beneath
boardgame.description:
Buried Beneath is a Solo, Worker Placement, Hero Defense game that fits in a mint-tin container.

Once a renowned and respected adventurer, you’ve long since retired to a peaceful town, tucked way up in the mountains. You spend most days relaxing out in the sun or at the tavern, regaling local villagers with your heroic triumphs of the past. Today though, is not shaping up to be like most days...

Unknown to you, a primordial horror had been slumbering beneath this very town, but something has stirred it from its eternal resting. And to make matters worse, the energy emitted by the awakening has drawn the attention of the local monster population, who now amass outside the village.

You will be placing villager meeples at varying village locations to either gain stat points or perform actions like moving, attacking, using skills or rallying the Villagers to perform additional duties. A villager's location should be picked carefully, because invading monsters will be advancing towards the village center, causing villagers in their way to flee in terror!

After defending the village for 4 waves, the ancient horror buried beneath you emerges from underground, ready for a fight!

To win, defeat the final Boss after defending the village from 4 waves of monsters!
You lose if your Hero is defeated, all of your villagers have fled or you let at least 4 monsters reach the village center.

boardgame.name: Nest of Snakes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nest of Snakes is an adventure for the Weird Frontiers role-playing game and is designed to be played with a group of four to six 3rd level characters. The adventure concerns a debased family of French aristocracy dwelling in a dilapidated plantation manor in the swamps of Louisiana. The family’s depraved occult practices and their long isolation have transformed them into a clan of rougarou—a creature that shares traits with both werewolves and vampires. The family estate harbors both terrors and treasures for the party brave and dedicated enough to survive this metaphorical serpents’ nest.

boardgame.name: Barbed Angels
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

These terrifying creatures are the result of horrendous torture inflicted upon celestial beings, usually in a layer of the Abyss or one of the Hells. Not quite a “fallen” angel, these creatures do not act out of their own free will. Rather, their minds are twisted and ensnared by the barbed halo they wear, implanted through their skulls once their torture is complete.

This PDF contains the lore and stats for two creatures, the barbed angel and barbed commander, as well as a magic item created when they are slain, the Fallen Halo. It also contains a high-res handout for each angel.

boardgame.name: Champions of Destruction
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Embrace the Waaagh! and become a Champion of Destruction!

Champions of Destruction allows players to create the most brutally cunning — or cunningly brutal — characters for Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound! Become Da Boss, set out across the Mortal Realms in search of a good scrap, and face down the biggest, baddest, creatures in all of the realms! The book features new Destruction aligned Species, new Archetypes, new Talents, tooth splittingly destructive new spells, Miracles and more.

Champions of Destruction contains:

A head-scratching look at the gods of Destruction, and why they might stop scrappin’ long enough to beat a group of Soulbound into shape.
Mechanics for wielding the power of the Waaagh!, recruiting a gang of like minded bruisers to join you in your rampage, and becoming Da Boss of your own warband.
Options to play as brutal Orruks, cunning Kruleboyz, spiteful Hobgrots, diminutive Grots, belching Ogors, and rock-smashing Troggoths, as well as advice on who your character needs to crump to become Soulbound, and dozens of sample Short- and Long- term Goals.
Over 20 new Destruction-aligned Archetypes, such as the Squig-riding Boingrot Bounder, Waaagh! blasting Weirdnob Shaman, flame-belching Ogor Firebelly, wicked Kruleboy Gutrippa and many more.
Over 50 cunning and brutal Talents, 60 powerful Miracles from the Gods of Destruction, and 70 spells all drawn from bizzare Lores of Magic wielded by Grots, Orruks, and Ogors.
Dozens of new pieces of equipment and artefacts to get your mitts on, and swing at your enemies.
Over 25 new Endeavours for Destruction characters to undertake between adventures, such as squaring off against Da Boss, capering under the Bad Moon, or beating armour into shape with your bare fists.
Advice for Gamemasters and players on running Destruction-focused campaigns, as well as statistics for a gibbering mountain of Squigs, Grots, Gnoblars and other minions and mounts to beat down or boss around.

boardgame.name: Surgerock Vault
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The very oceans and seas tremble in fear of the floating rock that parts its waves, traveling to destinations only the gods know. The pock marked monstrosity defies sinking as it roams the sea, it’s cargo a mystery. What deadly mysteries reside within this strange floating rock?

An OSE adventure for levels 7-9.

boardgame.name: Seas of Everglow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the deep reaches of the ocean, there lie things so easily forgotten, but they do not return that favor. Friendly and not, their eyes watch, unblinking. Do you dare to get your feet wet and discover what wonders await?

New Subraces, including six 5e, nine PF1, and seventeen PF2 heritages!
An astounding array of feats to customize yourself with fifty-five PF1, fifteen 5E, and ninety-one PF2 feats!
Three new races for 5E, PF1, and PF2
Magic for all sorts, with nine 5E, eight PF1, and eighteen PF2 spells!
Take your classes in new directions with two 5E class options, one PF1 Archetype, and two PF2 archetypes.
Three new cleric doctrines(PF2)
One new witch patron for PF2
Ten new settlements!
Nine new familiar abilities (PF2)
Seven new backgrounds (PF2)
Four new backgrounds (5E)
Thirty-two different notables that live in, on, or near the waves.
One new god for 5E, PF1, and PF2, welcome Monsoon, feline god of seas and travel.
New thoughts of gods about gods and the very nature of their being.
Eight monsters for 5E, PF1, and PF2
One new class, the thoughtful psion(5e, pf1 and pf2 with 65 additional class feats(including multi-classing)!)

boardgame.name: Shepherd's Bane (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A werewolf roams the foggy reaches of Sterling Moor and the village of Harroch is at its mercy. Tonight is the night of the full moon. Can you protect the people of Harroch from the monster’s wrath? Or will you too succumb to the teeth and claws of the Shepherd’s Bane?

Shepherd’s Bane is a freeform adventure that is centered around on the village of Harroch, which lies in the bleak hills and bogs of Sterling Moor. Dark forces beset the village. The trouble started with the arrival of a group of wandering entertainers known as the Calatoré, one of whom was a werewolf. A fight occurred and the werewolf was driven off, but not before it infected the village priest and the many of the villagers with its disease. The village’s women and children know that something is wrong with their sons and husbands, but they believe they are just overwhelmed by the search for the werewolf that still prowls the moors.

Shepherd’s Bane, an adventure for characters of levels 1st to 3rd, takes our heroes from the fog shrouded Sterling Moor into the village of Harroch as they face off against a danger that stalks the night and takes the unwary or unlucky. That there is a werewolf on the hunt is obvious, but who is the fiend? Is it the desolate warden Bostwick? Traveling teller of fortunes Katya? Perhaps the wolf hunter Smythe? It could be you. It could be me. Whoever it is they must be stopped, and Father Wilhelm has a plan, a plan that involves a tall wooden stake and a lit torch.

boardgame.name: Shepherd's Bane (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A werewolf roams the foggy reaches of Sterling Moor and the village of Harroch is at its mercy. Tonight is the night of the full moon. Can you protect the people of Harroch from the monster’s wrath? Or will you too succumb to the teeth and claws of the Shepherd’s Bane?

Shepherd’s Bane is a freeform adventure that is centered around on the village of Harroch, which lies in the bleak hills and bogs of Sterling Moor. Dark forces beset the village. The trouble started with the arrival of a group of wandering entertainers known as the Calatoré, one of whom was a werewolf. A fight occurred and the werewolf was driven off, but not before it infected the village priest and the many of the villagers with its disease. The village’s women and children know that something is wrong with their sons and husbands, but they believe they are just overwhelmed by the search for the werewolf that still prowls the moors.

Shepherd’s Bane, an adventure for characters of levels 1st to 3rd, takes our heroes from the fog shrouded Sterling Moor into the village of Harroch as they face off against a danger that stalks the night and takes the unwary or unlucky. That there is a werewolf on the hunt is obvious, but who is the fiend? Is it the desolate warden Bostwick? Traveling teller of fortunes Katya? Perhaps the wolf hunter Smythe? It could be you. It could be me. Whoever it is they must be stopped, and Father Wilhelm has a plan, a plan that involves a tall wooden stake and a lit torch.

boardgame.name: Shepherd's Bane: PFRPG 1st Edition Addendum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a conversion addendum of Shepherd's Bane by Necromancer Games. That product is required to use this addendum.

Shepherd’s Bane is a freeform adventure that is centered around on the village of Harroch, which lies in the bleak hills and bogs of Sterling Moor. Dark forces beset the village. The trouble started with the arrival of a group of wandering entertainers known as the Calatoré, one of whom was a werewolf. A fight occurred and the werewolf was driven off, but not before it infected the village priest and the many of the villagers with its disease. The village’s women and children know that something is wrong with their sons and husbands, but they believe they are just overwhelmed by the search for the werewolf that still prowls the moors.

Shepherd’s Bane, written for characters of levels 1st to 3rd, takes our heroes from the fog shrouded Sterling Moor into the village of Harroch as they face off against a danger that stalks the night and takes the unwary or unlucky. That there is a werewolf on the hunt is obvious, but who is the fiend? Is it the desolate warden Bostwick? Traveling teller of fortunes Katya? Perhaps the wolf hunter Smythe? It could be you. It could be me. Whoever it is they must be stopped and Father Wilhelm has a plan, a plan that involves a tall wooden stake and a lit torch.

boardgame.name: Admiral of the Fleet: Flag Officer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
Flag Officer's Handbook: 50 pages of rules and diagrams plus printable signal card deck (67 cards) and Flag Officer Signal Book sheet.

The FOH explains in detail how the cards can be used to add a new dimension to your naval gaming experience by introducing this innovative method for aspiring flag officers to command their fleet on the game table. Due to the popularity of surface-only engagements and the difficulties inherent in an accurate portrayal of the additional dimensions required by the addition of aircraft and submarines to the game table, it focuses exclusively on surface warfare during the age of the battleship.

You can signal your divisions, squadrons and flotillas to execute a pre-determined battle order, turn in succession by division, alter course 3 points to starboard, distribute fire from the left, attack the enemy van and even perform a battle turn (Gefechtskehrtwendung)!

Required to play AOTF, but can also be used with other naval wargame rules.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: First Strike
boardgame.description:
A fast and fun game of missile warfare for two players. Victory depends on both skill and luck.

Use your small missiles to knock out an incoming attack while your larger missiles go after your opponent's command post. Or hit with consecutive massive waves of both missiles and trust your luck!

Develop new tactics with each game you play and become invincible!

On your turn roll the dice and move your various missiles while keeping your command post protected. Destroy your opponent's missiles when yours strike theirs, and win by destroying your opponent's command post!

boardgame.name: Unique Locations: Collection 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether encountered on a quest, or simply found while traveling from here to there, feel free to add these unique locations to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

An undiscovered doorway in an ancient underground dwarven empire
A fountain spouting fresh water in an abandoned oasis
The tomb of an unknown female warrior in a roadside chapel
A noose hanging from a tree outside a small city

boardgame.name: Pescado Novo
boardgame.description:
Pescado Novo is a fishing game based on the classic card game Scopa di Quindici. It has a special set of cards that are randomly added to the deck and provide special effects, such as:

- Immediatly taking one card from the table.
- A -1 card
- An 11
etc

The game can be played from 2 to 4 players. In 4 players match the game is played in teams.

boardgame.name: Admiral of the Fleet: Scenarios Volume I
boardgame.description:
Scenarios Volume I: 66 pages including background information, maps, orders of battle (OOB) and setup diagrams plus 169 pages of pre-formatted, ready-to-print ship logs. Ship Logs are required to play AOTF.

The 5 scenarios include:

The Battle of Tsushima (1905 - historical),
The Battle of Crete (1898 - fictional),
The Battle of Dogger Bank (1915 - historical),
The Battle of the Komandorski Islands (1943 - both historical and fictional), and
The Battle of Jutland-Run to the South (1916 - historical)

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ROVE: Expansion Collection
boardgame.description:
A wallet collection of three 6-card Mission Pack expansions for ROVE: Results-Oriented Versatile Explorer:


Icy Incidents
Alien Activities
Cosmic Crisis



Follow setup from the base game, but shuffle the cards from one or more Mission Packs into the deck of Mission/Movement cards before drawing your starting hand.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: ROVE: Alien Activities
ROVE: Cosmic Crisis
ROVE: Icy Incidents

boardgame.name: Casting Shadows
boardgame.description:
Explore a dark, enchanting world and battle your opponents in this 2-4 player turn-based competitive strategic board game.

Throughout the game, you'll collect resources, learn new spells, summon a companion, and - if you're lucky - unlock your Shadow Form, all in the quest to become the ultimate Shadow Caster.

The last player standing after this supernatural showdown wins the game!




How to Play

Your turn consists of 3 phases:

Phase 1
Take the 5 Resource dice and roll them in front of you to form your Resource Pool, which contains the Resources you can spend this turn. If you start your turn on a Hex tile that grants you a specific Resource, add the corresponding Resource token to your Resource Pool.

Phase 2
During this phase, you get 4 Action points to spend, and you can use them to perform any of the Actions below in any order. Each Action costs 1 Action point. You can perform the same Action more than once on your turn if you still have Action points tospend. You do not have to spend all 4 Action points each turn, but unused Action points do not roll over to subsequent turns.

Your Actions include:

TRAVEL: Move your Character from your current Hex tile (the Hex tile where your Meeple currently stands) to any adjacent Hex tile.
COLLECT: Move a Spell, Counterspell, or Resource card from next to your current Hex tile to your Spell Book by spending the required Resources shown in the card’s Collection Cost. After you Collect a Spell or Resource card, immediately replace it with the top card from the Main deck. If you Collect a Counterspell card from the Counterspell deck, you do not need to replace it with a card from the Main deck.
REFRESH: Move the card next to your current Hex tile to the discard pile and replace it with the top card from the Main deck. You cannot Refresh a card from an Ancient Rune Hex tile or a Dusty Desert Hex tile.
REROLL: Choose any number of rolled Resource dice and roll them again. You cannot Reroll Cursed Crystals.
PROTECT: Remove 1 Cursed Crystal from your Resource Pool. Heads up: Any Cursed Crystals remaining in front of you will hurt you at the end of your turn!
CAST: Spend Resources to use a Spell card effect from your Spell Book. You can use each Spell card effect only once per turn. In addition to an Action point cost, some Actions (such as COLLECT and CAST) require you to spend Resources. Remove spent Resources from your Resource Pool by returning that Resource to the central area of Resource dice and tokens.


Phase 3
During this phase, you may absorb any remaining Shadow Fragments in your Resource Pool by moving your Shadow Tracker up by that amount. If you’ve absorbed enough Shadow Energy and you are in your Base Form, you may immediately transform into Shadow Form.



How to Win

When the dust settles and the echoes of the last spell fade, there can be only one victor. The last player standing is crowned the champion and wins the game.

View the Rulebook
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Casting Shadows: Exclusive Edition
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Casting Shadows: Lucky Skipper / Lucky the Unstable Player Board
Casting Shadows: The Ice Storm Expansion

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
PREORDER KS Casting Shadow + Expansion:
The Kickstarter Exclusive edition of Casting Shadows features a Kickstarter Exclusive magnetic box. In addition to all the cards and components in the standard edition, it comes with 15 Kickstarter Exclusive standard-sized cards, 3 Kickstarter Exclusive Hex tiles, 2 Kickstarter Exclusive Player Boards, 2 Kickstarter Exclusive Meeples, and 8 Shadow Meeples. The box is also upgraded to accommodate sleeved cards as well as all cards and components in the Casting Shadows Expansion Pack as well as the Unicorn character Player Board, Meeple, and Shadow Meeple.
Casting Shadows: The Ice Storm Expansion includes 23 standard-sized cards, 3 Hex tiles, 10 Status tokens, 2 Player boards, and 2 meeples. This Expansion Pack allows you to play Casting Shadows with up to 6 players.
Final sale. Delays are common

boardgame.name: River Trek
boardgame.description:
A strategy game of placing trading posts and moving stacks of explorers, called caravans, along the path of a river.

On your turn, you will pick up a stack of explorers, called a Caravan, and move it mancala-style by dropping the explorers one at a time off the bottom of the stack as it travels forward. Each explorer dropped on a space will earn money if there is a trading post of the same color on the space, so other players may earn money on your move. Drop an explorer on a river crossing, and it will wash downstream to the previous river crossing. Drop an explorer on an animal token, and the owner of that explorer will have a special ability.

When a Caravan reaches the source of the river, the game ends and the player who has made the most money along the way wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stowe
boardgame.description:
Stowe evolves the game of Chess to a new level by allowing a player's pieces to stack on top of each other through any legal Chess move. As stacks grow, each one may move like the normal movement of the top piece or may use a secondary movement ability determined by the height of the stack. Each piece has a number on it that corresponds to the height stack needed to use its movement ability. Stacked pieces can unstack, but only one at a time and can only move like the piece unstacking.

Turn Overview: On a players turn, they may move any one of their 16 pieces according to traditional Chess piece movements. A player may use any of these movements to stack one or more pieces on top of another. If a stack of pieces already exists, a player may unstack the top piece according to it's Chess movement ability. Only one piece can unstack at a time. After a player makes one move, play proceeds to the next player.

Like traditional Chess the game ends when one player Wins by capturing their opponent's King, or results in a Stalemate if no players posses the ability to capture their opponents King.

Other variants of play include:
Minimizing the board to 3 or 5 lanes, and following the recommended setup.
Using the Stowe Backgammon Dice to have players moves be determined by rolling a dice.
In Wild West Chess players simply stack on top of opponents when capturing pieces. If de-stacked opponents gain back control of their piece(s).

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Innistrad: Crimson Vow
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering tells the story of the wedding of Olivia Voldaren and Edgar Markov, two of the most powerful vampires on the gothic horror world of Innistrad. But it's not just a wedding celebration—it's also the kickoff for a dark ritual that could allow Olivia to take over the world, unless some brave heroes can crash the party and object in time!

Innistrad: Crimson Vow is a direct sequel to Innistrad: Midnight Hunt, sharing several of the same mechanics and themes. However, where Midnight Hunt shone a spotlight on werewolves, Crimson Vow has a vampire theme. Each vampire card in the set has a special "fang frame" showcase version that appears in boosters approximately half as often as the normal version. Additionally, 18 cards from the set were given a special re-skin representing characters, locations, and events from Bram Stoker's Dracula. These "Dracula Series" cards feature a full-art borderless frame and are found only in collector boosters and as box toppers.

This set contains 277 cards (100 commons, 83 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 10 full-art "Eternal Night" basic lands) and is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Magic: The Gathering — Innistrad: Double Feature

boardgame.name: Starfinder Spell Cards
boardgame.description:
Side of the Box Blurb

Hold the magic of the galaxy in your hands with Starfinder Spell Cards, the must-have accessory no science-fantasy her can do without! This box includes more than 250 spell reference cards, covering every spell in the Starfinder Core Rulebook and Starfinder Character Operations Manual, giving players instant access to game details at a glance!

boardgame.name: Your Care Is...
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
YOUR CARE IS... is a collection of six player options for Wanderhome.

Each focuses one of the many ways people care, truly, deeply and profoundly, about the people and world around them.


The Almanagist, researcher for the latest issue of the Hæth Almanack.
The Gravedigger, stoic and respectful in their treatment of the dead.
The Stargazer, a storyteller who reads from the heavens.
The Stemsage, a herbalist dispensing remedies with shy smile.
The Toymaker, a craftsperson who delights in the joyful whimsy of play.
The Trailblazer, burning with a singular passion for their game.

boardgame.name: Alien Archive 1 & 2 Battle Cards
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box Blurb

Stsrfinder Alien Archive and Alien Archive 2 are excellent tools for planning exciting science fantasy adventures, but this box of 315 cards presents a new and exciting way for your extraterrestrial creatures to land on the table and join the fight. Each card features a beautiful, full-color image of a creature from Alien Archive or Alien Archive 2 on one side, while the other side provides that creature's statistics for quick and easy reference. Shoe the players what alien menace their characters are facing while keeping the creatures abilities at the ready, and watch your game come alive!

boardgame.name: City Alien Quarter Expansion
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

Home Away from Home!

Sometimes adventure takes you to the alien side of town. Next time your players are looking for a taste of off-world cuisine and culture while in the big city, they won't have to wait while you draw every doorway and room. Starfinder Flip-Tiles: City Alien Quarter Expansion provides beautifully illustrated 6" × 6" map tiles that can be used to expand your city with a neighborhood fit for extraterrestrial habitation! Inside, you'll find 24 richly crafted, double-sided map tiles. This expansion set, along with Starfinder Flip-Tiles: City Starter Set, allows you to create futuristic urban locales with endless variety! So stop your sketching and start your flipping today! The City Alien Quarter Expansion includes:

Alternative Atmospheres
Aquatic Environments
Recreation Towers
Sauna and pool
Airlocks
Alien Lavatories

boardgame.name: Alien Planet Ruins
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

Sift Through the Ruins

Don't ruin your next trip off world! Next time your players stumble upon some timeworn ruins on an unexplored planet, they won't have to wait while you draw every crumbling wall and collapsed structure. Starfinder Flip-Tiles: Alien Planet Ruins Expansion provides beautifully illustrated 6" × 6" map tiles that can be used to create the ruined remains of ancient alien civilizations, whether archaic and magical or more technologically advanced! Inside, you'll find 24 richly crafted, double-sided map tiles. This expansion set, along with Starfinder Flip-Tiles: Alien Planet Starter Set, allows you to create even more extraterrestrial environments for endless planetary encounters! So stop your sketching and start your flipping today! The City Alien Quarter Expansion includes:

Shimmering flora
Ancient Roads
Eldritch crossroads
Crystal remains
Toppled edifices
Radioactive cores

boardgame.name: I'm Right You're Wrong: Shots Fired
boardgame.description: This is the expansion for the hilariously, combative, I'm Right You're Wrong, a game about arguments. Interrupt the argument with hilarious drinking rules.

boardgame.name: Yura Yura Penguin Mini
boardgame.description:
Yura Yura Penguin is a card game and dexterity game for kids and adults alike. Help the penguins turn the ocean water into ice and build a beautiful home for them! Of course, don't break the iceberg!

Compact, anytime, anywhere. A small, portable version! A miniature version of Yura Yura Penguin, Yura Yura Penguin Mini is easy to carry and can be played in a small space."

Players will take turns stacking a card after completing the challenge on the card played before them, including adding penguins, ice rocks, and icicles. A mix of Uno and Jenga, the game involves adding to the tower without knocking it over. First player to get rid of their cards wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Masterminds: Heist Society
boardgame.description:
In Masterminds: Heist Society you are the shot-caller, assembling a team of operatives to take down the toughest modern-day heists!

We all love a good heist movie; Oceans 11, Baby Driver, Inside Man, and TV shows like Leverage bring us the thrill and suspense of assembling a team of specialists that combine their skills toward a common goal. Collecting the prize knowing they have pulled off the impossible. This game for 2-5 players aims to recreate the tension and thrill of planning and executing high-stakes heists, with cards and actions inspired by these movies and shows, as you and your fellow players take on the role of Masterminds.

Combining drafting, dice-rolling, and a strategic press-your-luck style of mission completion, Masterminds - Heist Society will test your risk/reward intuition as you play. Players can take it safe & slow to skip the die rolling and guarantee a win, but another player may swoop in and grab the prize out from under you with a more reckless luck-oriented plan. Either way, the prize goes to the first team to complete each heist’s combination of challenges.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lockdown!: A Card Game
boardgame.description:
Travel back in time to the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic and slip into the role of governments, as they implement various measures to contain the disease in their country, Save the most COVID-19 patients, while different forms of trouble arise on the way. Find out which public health measure to employ in each situation and ask for international collaboration when things get really tough.

Lockdown! is a fun and educational, competitive card game for 2 to 6 players where players draft cards and try to lay out COVID management measures and sending the patients to the relevant location. The goal of the game is to score more points than your opponent(s). Make use of cards to disrupt other players COVID management measures. each treated patient earns you a point. You win if you have treated more patients than your opponent(s) at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: National University of Singapore Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health

boardgame.name: Sagrajas 1086
boardgame.description:
Tactical wargame for two players that reproduces the battle of Sagrajas between the Castilian-Leonese troops and the Almoravides, which resulted in the defeat of the Leonese.

Published in Alea, #38 (March, 2022)



Wargame táctico para dos jugadores que reproduce la batalla de Sagrajas entre las tropas castellano-leonesas y los almoravides, que se saldo con la derrota de los leoneses.en Alea, #38 (Marzo, 2022)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Towns Like Ours
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Shapeshifters in Turn are always finding new things to get stressed out about, and new ways to ease that stress. Imagine what they can find as they go beyond the rural United States! This new original content for the Turn roleplaying game includes more time in small town in America in Smeed Hill, representing towns affected by economic crises, where you meet the human Holdout, and the beast Squirrel and Skunk. It also explores the ocean-front commuter town Harmouth in the United Kingdom, where you meet the human Traveller, and the beast Seagull and Badger. You also travel to Halver in Germany, based on the author's hometown and rich with history, introducing the human Snowake and beast European Hare and Grey Heron. Finally, this book opens up a detailed perspective on Italian culture, representing two towns and introducing the human roles of the Keeper and the Second Generation, and the beast archetypes of the Roe, Boar, Falcon, and a modified Bear.

There's so many miles and so many moments to experience in this collection, and enough material to tell different stories in the same towns as you find all the nooks and crannies of the town's history. And when you're done, you can simply take a trip to the next town! Find out how these towns are different, and how they're really just towns like ours, as you play.

boardgame.name: Dědicové trůnu: Královny a rádce
Heimliche Herrschaft: Königinnen & Kumpel
Hidden Leaders: Koninginnen & Co
Hidden Leaders: Queens & Friend
히든 리더스 : 여왕 & 동료
boardgame.description:
An expansion for Hidden Leaders that adds 3 modules:

- "3 Queens and the Friend"
- "8 bonus Heroes"
- "Keeper of Discord".

It also includes 5 non-Hero cards that can be used either as a portable board or game helper cards.

(Included in KS Edition of Hidden Leaders)
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Hidden Leaders: Kickstarter Edition

boardgame.name: Pirates, Pegasi, and Peril
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Out on the open skies above the Diamond Coast, the Golden Rift soars on gilded wings, shipping goods from port to port. But as of late, pirates have begun attacking their vessel atop winged mounts and they show no sign of stopping. Can you save the airship before the pirates take it down for good?

Pirates, Pegasi, and Peril is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 12th to 16th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 15.

This adventure contains 3 new monsters, 3 custom battlemaps with a custom airship token, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#5 - The Retirement of Harry Crane)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of Blaster Bolts features

Trappings of the Void - an article detailing new hirelings and gear for Void Knights by Walt Robillard
A new story by scifi writer Robert Greenberger- The Retirement of Harry Crane

boardgame.name: Radiant Heart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tragic are the lives of those born with the power of the Radiant Heart. These good-willed sorcerers who take on the role of sages or oracles bear the amazing ability to cure others of ailments and curses by some divine miracle. Yet, rather than neutralizing these afflictions, the Radiant Heart sorcerers absorb them and suffer their effects in the afflicted’s stead. In the form of self-sacrifice through the power granted by some cruel god, they take on the ills that plague the mortal world, left slowly corrupting to the point of breaking under the pressure of all the world’s evils.

boardgame.name: Expanded Options 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More tthe Merrier!
(For Pathfinder 1e and the Spheres of Power/Might systems)

Providing a menagerie of new options for the Spheres system, Expanded Options 3 sets out to explore and develop areas of the Spheres system that have not been delved into as much.

Use the new (smash) tag for the Barroom sphere to really enhance your improvised fighting, or the plethora of Advanced and Legendary talents to further break the bonds of reality (and your GMs sanity).

New archetypes and class options give an interesting spin on pre-existing classes, such as the Chromamancer, who uses color to enhance their magic; or the new Conscript and Incanter sub-specializations to flesh out the parts that the original specializations didn’t cover (like an Incanter Specialization for every Nature sphere package!).

Even well-developed options within Spheres have received some love, in the form of working on the weird and wonderful side of such options. The Warden class has received two new
vigils: Adaptability for the Alteration sphere, and Subtlety for the Scoundrel sphere! Plus, the Sage has received some attention in the form of the Ki Convergent Esoteric Training and the
Confluence archetype, trading one pop culture inspiration for another.

With Expanded Options 3, there’s a little something for everyone!

boardgame.name: The Grimm Forest: Genie & Magic Lamp promo cards
boardgame.description:
These are two new Fable cards which can interact with each other.

Genie:
"End of Gather Phase: If you are in a Location with another player you may immediatly build a Floor or Walls for half the cost. If the Magic Lamp is in the discard pile, you may instead build a Floor or Walls for free."

Magic Lamp:
"When Revealed: Draw the top three cards of the Fable deck. Choose 1 to play immediatly and discard the other two. If the Genie is in the discard pile, draw the other two cards instead."

German edition:
Grimms Wälder: Flaschengeist & Wunderlampe

boardgame.name: Disney Trivia
boardgame.description:
Trivia Game with Disney and Pixar theme. 140 question cards with 4 multiple choice options. It's for you to decide the difficulty level: difficult (ask the question only), medium (ask the question with all 4 choice options) or easy (ask the question with just the 50:50 choices).

The team with more points at the end wins.

boardgame.name: Heimliche Herrschaft: Kickstarter Deluxe-Edition
Hidden Leaders: Kickstarter Edition
boardgame.description:
Hidden Leaders: Kickstarter Edition includes the following items not included in retail version of this game:

- Queens & Friend mini expansion
- Game board incl. spot UV
- Silkscreen printed meeples
- 2 custom cardboard tokens

In Hidden Leaders, you take the role of one of six secret leaders, each of them is allied with two of the four factions/colors. By playing heroes into your tableau, either openly or secretly, you influence the outcome of the conflict.

At the end of the game, one of the four factions will win. Each player who is aligned with the winning faction can claim the victory. However, they must have more heroes of this color than any competitor.

Hidden Leaders is a quick, light strategy card game with direct player interaction. It combines tableau building and deduction elements with its unique winning mechanism. This is a game of great tension with no-down time, that’s fast to learn.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Hidden Leaders
Hidden Leaders: Queens & Friend

boardgame.name: Gravestone Deep
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

Be scared of the water, the current and the ocean too! A frightening tall building of hard material moves around the seas, disgorging its killer shipment of reptilian reprobates wherever it chances to beach itself!

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops Second Strike (2nd Ed.)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Ghost Ops Second Strike Roleplaying Game is a game of covert operations in the modern world. You, as a player, choose and create a character from one of five different specialist military, law enforcement, or private-sector forces in which to take on missions across the world.

In the game, you can now play as:

Tactical Police Units
Special Forces
Special Agents
PMCs
ICO Ghosts


You can choose from 23 different countries and 94 different specialist law enforcement and military units making this the biggest Ghost Ops yet.

Ghost Ops was initially inspired by Tom Clancy’s books and the games produced by Ubisoft, but having knowledge of either of these influences is not needed to play. However, an understanding of how Special forces and Special Law Enforcement agencies operate will be beneficial.

For Handlers, we live in a world of inspiration for missions to tax your players. Turn on the news or read a newspaper to discover a myriad of objectives, plots, and ideas for exciting and dangerous adventures. Be they taking down Mexican Drug Cartels to facing the threat of Rogue Nations and Highly funded Terrorist organisations.

For those who do not like using special dice, such as Fudge dice, other systems are included at the back, allowing you to play the game using either D6 or D100 percentile rules. Whatever your preference, there is no excuse not to play Ghost Ops Second Strike.

Sourcebooks and Mission Files from the original Ghost Ops Modern Warfare RPG are compatible with Second Strike
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: The Fantasy Role-Playing Previous History System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Most of the published previous history systems either make a character too skilled and rich or provide too sketchy a background to motivate character actions. Hopefully, [this] system will alleviate that.

User summary:

A system-agnostic series of random tables to generate a character's history, prior to their advent in a game.

boardgame.name: Sanctuary: The Keepers Era – Champions of Elnerth Foil Cards
boardgame.description:
The Champions & Villains cards set contains 6 foil champion cards, with a really nice foil finish. There is no additional content. This was originally released as part of Dice Tower 2021 KS C Pack
-Thannen Champion
-Antar Champion
-Ganto Champion
-Kras Champion
-Molran Champion
-Wul Champion

boardgame.name: Tadhana: Adventurer's Kit Starter Rulebook
boardgame.description:
A Filipino Tabletop Role-Playing Game

Publisher's blurb:

Set in the universe of Kalawakan, Tadhana is an adventure tabletop role-playing game inspired by Filipino folklore, urban legends, and mythology. Featuring an uncommon take on fantasy, players can experience a world full of magic and encounter creatures, deities, and the supernatural previously only found in Filipino stories, epics, superstitions, and legends. The game is powered by a dice-less, card-based resolution system and features flexible and dynamic attribute resource mechanics.

boardgame.name: Bulong
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Bulong is a starter campaign meant to be played by 3 – 5 players. The playthrough will take 7 – 10 hours to complete and will take the adventurers from Character Levels 1 up to 3. This booklet will guide the Overseer on how to conduct the campaign and provide the required information and statistics. As a disclaimer, it should be mentioned that while an Overseer may modify or add story elements to the campaign, it is recommended for first time Overseers to follow the guide with little to no deviations. This chapter will provide starting tips and instructions as well as a descriptive explanation of the setting of the campaign.

boardgame.name: Kundiman Ikaw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Kundiman Ikaw is an introductory romantic adventure for Tadhana, specifically designed to work well with groups that love combat, dramatic sequences, or mysticism. Can there be love between an Aswang and a Diwata? What songs will be sung of this union?

boardgame.name: What Still Remains
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An earthquake has rumbled throughout the continent of Eskri and some townsfolk of Port Lost have found what seems like partially buried ruins that have been laying quiet in the dirt. For how long? Who knows. After one of the town scouts returns with news of strange activity and a terrible incident, the Lakan reaches out to you and your party to help out. Will you and your friends find What Still Remains?

What Still Remains is a 9-part adventure for Tadhana RPG, optimized to take characters from levels 1 - 3 and is designed to run for an estimate of 5-7 hours.

boardgame.name: Grasp of the Crooked Coven
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A level 1-5 campaign of fey whimsy & terror

Grasp of the Crooked Coven is a campaign that includes both a setting guide and adventure path for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition and compiles all of the information contained in the individual GCC supplements and adventures in one PDF and is also available for print on demand. Chapter one contains all the information you need to run adventures in the Mistwood, a sylvan forest of magic, wonder, and terror. Chapter two describes the nearby timber village of Oak Hollow, its notable locations, resident NPCs, and relevant side quests. Chapters three through seven are five interconnected adventures centered around a coven of wicked hags and their insidious brood. Designed for characters of 1st to 5th level, these adventures can be run individually or tied together into a campaign about the destruction of the Crooked Coven and their machinations to bring ruin upon a small village and its residents.

boardgame.name: Mar 23, 2022 (Bonus Map)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: The Earl's Castle Retreat

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: The Haunted Dungeon

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Mar 20, 2022 (Bonus Map)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Warrior Lord's Abode

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map
