boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Puzzle Dungeon

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Mar 18, 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Arcane College Campus

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Hag's Blood Tree
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an evil druid or hag’s tree?

This giant, inhabited tree features four blood-red pools on its giant branches, which are filled with skeletons. At the centre of the tree is a room with a magical, glowing red mark. Bookshelves line the walls. Around the tree are red vines and crimson trees. The whole area looks cursed.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a druid trying to lift the curse through sacrifice, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Moonwells of the Great Tree
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a tree filled with magical wells?

This giant tree has four glowing blue pools on its giant branches, while at its centre is a room with a magical, glowing blue mark. Bookshelves line the walls. Vines line the trees branch walkways, while around the tree is a night blue forest.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving night elves who are stuck in The Great Nightmare, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Elven Moonwell Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an elven village in a tree, filled with magical wells?

This giant tree has four glowing blue pools on its giant branches, while at its centre is a room with a magical, glowing blue mark. Bookshelves line the walls. Vines line the trees branch walkways, which little huts have been built into. All around the tree is a lush, green forest.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving snobbish elves and their magical healing wells, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Shrine of the Moon Druids
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a shrine-tree filled with magical wells?

This giant tree has four glowing blue pools on its giant branches, while at its centre is a room with a magical, glowing blue mark. Bookshelves line the walls. Vines line the trees branch walkways, while around the tree is a lush, green forest.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving magical shrimp farming and a cute beetle-monster, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Angels of War Graveyard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a war memorial guarded by angel statues?

This tomb sits in the middle of a luscious park, with manicured paths winding their way through the surrounding graves. Outside the graveyard waits a healthy green forest, while inside the tomb itself are the sepulchres of heroes. Stairs wind down beneath the tomb, into darkness below…

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving an amusing “undead” plot-twist to teach murder-hobos a lesson with, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: City Park War Memorial
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a beautiful war memorial in the heart of a city?

This memorial sits in the middle of a luscious park, surrounded by flowers and manicured paths. Pillars reach their way up to the sky, while beyond the park waits a healthy green forest. Inside the tomb itself are the sepulchres of heroes from battles long past, while on the exterior walls are engraved names from more the fallen. Stairs wind down beneath the tomb, into dark catacombs below…

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving false-flag vandalism against the tomb in protest of conscriptions, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Mana Waste's Dread Mausoleum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a mausoleum in mana wastes?

This tower-crypt waits in the heart of blasted mana wastes, with green crystals growing out of the earth around it. An abandoned path winds its way around it, while dead trees stretch their twisted limbs to the sky around it. Inside the tomb itself are sepulchres, while wind down beneath the tomb, into the dark below…

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving a scholar who seeks to become immortal through the magic of this place (so he can finish his work), you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Fisherman's Ruined Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a ruined temple in a sea-cave?

This hard-to-get-to ruins flood with the changing tides, and are filled with nets a fisherman has strung about and caught some fish with. Red corals and slime grow on the walls, while fallen statues form bridges above the tide-swell. A huge stone tablet stands in a nearby chamber, chained to the walls. One of the rooms has mystical carvings in the floor, while further in is a sacrificial alter stained with blood.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving Lovecraftian Deep Ones, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Fisherman's Ruined Temple High Tide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an underwater sea-cave with a ruined temple?

These hard-to-get-to ruins are flooded with the high-tide. The shimmering sunlight ripples down through the water, illuminating empty nets and schools of living fish darting between seaweed and red corals. Fallen statues form bridges at low tide. A huge stone tablet stands in a nearby chamber, chained to the walls. One of the rooms has mystical carvings in the floor, while further in is a sacrificial alter stained with blood.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving Lovecraftian Deep Ones, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Underwater Shipwrecked Temple Ruin
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an underwater temple battlemap?

This ruined temple was built beneath the waves, waved deep into a cliff along a dangerous coastline. Shimmering sunlight ripples down through the water which fills the ruins, illuminating empty nets and schools of living fish darting between seaweed and red corals. Fallen statues form bridges at low tide. A huge stone tablet stands in a nearby chamber, chained to the walls. One of the rooms has mystical carvings in the floor, while further in is a sacrificial alter stained with blood.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving searching for a wedding ring lost at sea, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Garden of the Giants
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Garden of the Giants is a tabletop roleplaying game that takes place in a magical garden abandoned by its original inhabitants. Left on their own, the animals have gained sentience and culture in their stead and now lead what they think are ordinary lives within the isolated stone walls.

Standing tall and abandoned by the Garden’s creators is the Interior, a cursed cottage full of ancient secrets and a source of great power: the Crown.

But where there is power, there are those who would hold it. Those who hold the Crown corrupt the Garden with their ambitions and designs. It is up to the mice, our protagonists played by the players, to overthrow the Crown and return harmony to the Garden.

Garden of the Giants tells tales similar to those you would find in children’s literature, stories of magical realms and self-discovery set against villainous plots or catastrophe. You play the game as the courageous mice, who seek an end to the tyranny of the Crown and its corrupting influence.

Garden of the Giants features 14 different scenarios (14 different Crowns) to play and 20 different Plots (each filled with interesting locations and compelling complications) to challenge your heroes to be. The game also includes rules and design philosophy for modifying Plots or creating your own.

The game is designed to help facilitate play and give both players (who take the role of the protagonists) and the Gardener (who takes the role of the Garden and its Denizens) the tools they need to build stories together, even if they have never played a roleplaying game before. Garden of the Giants is a perfect game for younger audiences, families, and anyone who enjoys whimsical tales!

boardgame.name: Fight a Bear!!!
boardgame.description: Fight a Bear!!! is a camping themed, strategy card game for 2-4 players. Players will take on the role of Campers as they battle their way through increasingly stronger bears with increasingly dumber pun names. But bears aren't the only thing to worry about! Campers can sabotage each other at any moment in order to get the advantage. Be the first Camper to reach 20 teeth and defeat an Extra Bad Bear, or be the last remaining camper with food rations to win the game!

listing.notes: I'll make sure to add a FREE Fight a Bear!!! promo card with any of our orders.

boardgame.name: Everdell: Pearlbrook – Rahdo Runs Through Alternate Art Cards
boardgame.description: Alternate Art Promo available from the Rahdo Runs Through channel that replaces the Messenger card.

boardgame.name: Transcendent
boardgame.description:
Compete as a rival scientist or alchemist in this Scientific Revolution themed deck builder. Using a starter deck of 10 cards, generate resources and acquire better cards from the market to create the best deck to complete your hidden objective before your opponents.

Merge your basic resources of fire, earth, air, and water to create purified elements which then merge to become game bending scientific achievements to tilt the game in your favor. Use advantages to help yourself and others towards their goals, or use sabotages to bring them to their knees.

The choice is yours in the quest to become Transcendent.

During their turn, players will begin with a Research Phase, where they add to their non-AEther resources. They will then proceed to their Experiment Phase, where they will have two labor points to choose any two of playing a card, resetting the market, increasing a resource, merging an element or achievement, or acquiring a card from the market. The last phase is the Clean-up Phase, where the player will discard their hand and draw a new one.

The game ends when a player has completed all the criteria on one of their hidden objectives. Play continues to finish up the round, with tie breakers being based on remaining resources at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Graveyard Ghoul RPG
boardgame.description: Graveyard Ghoul RPG is a printable solo horror fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of a ghoul exploring a netherworld necropolis. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and two six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Kingdom (2nd Ed.)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

People can work together to do great things. But what do we care about and what do we fight for? Who do we listen to and who pays the price?

That's what Kingdom is all about: communities and how the people in them decide what they stand for. You'll sit down together and create any kind of group or organization you want to explore:

A school for wayward wizards…

A revolutionary pharmaceutical company…

An anime fan club…

The first settlers on Mars…

As you play, you'll confront Crossroads, critical decisions that may change your community forever. What will your Kingdom do? What will it become? Strive to make your Kingdom live up to your ideals... or watch as it burns. The Kingdom is in your hands. The question is: will you change the Kingdom or will the Kingdom change you?

boardgame.name: Traveller: Explorer's Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Traveller is the science fiction roleplaying game of the far future. The Traveller Explorers’ Edition is an introduction to the game for newcomers that provides all of the tools you need to create adventures or even an entire campaign. Create bold scouts and intrepid scientists who travel into the unknown aboard their trusty Type-S Scout/Courier, a rugged exploration ship perfect for the job.

Dock your ship at advanced starports, visit strange worlds, encounter alien beings and animals, and take on the challenges that the galaxy sets before you.

The Explorer’s Edition provides all core game rules for Traveller, plus a universe creation system that allows referees to create new star systems on the fly for their players to visit and explore…

The universe awaits. Welcome to Traveller!

boardgame.name: Sector Construction Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Sector Construction Guide jumpstarts creativity to develop sectors of the referee’s own making, with a focus on the Foreven sector, an area adjacent to the Spinward Marches. The guidelines in this set provide tools to develop a detailed sector, whether in Charted Space or in an entirely different universe, covering overall setting creation, mainworlds, polities, and alien sophonts, with suggestions for variants to system creation rules to fit a referee’s unique ideas.

boardgame.name: Intro & Non-Player Character Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bats of Saint Abbans is an old-school adventure intended for The Midderlands setting suitable for Levels 1 to 3. The adventure is written for Swords & Wizardry and therefore can be used in all retro-clones and old school role-playing games with little or no work. The book may contain occasional swear words and mature themes.

This 36-page product contains the following :

Adventure flowchart
Introduction
The Town of Saint Abbans and its locations
Town adventure hooks
Town NPCs
Abbey NPCs
Random Monk Generator
Relationship Diagram

boardgame.name: Adventure Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bats of Saint Abbans is an old-school adventure intended for The Midderlands setting suitable for Levels 1 to 3. The adventure is written for Swords & Wizardry and therefore can be used in all retro-clones and old school role-playing games with little or no work. The book may contain occasional swear words and mature themes.

This 78-page product contains the following :

The Abbey and its Grounds
Ground Floor
Towers
Crypts & Cellars
Galleries
Roof-spaces
Bell Tower
Rooftops
Aftermath
Appendices

boardgame.name: Bestiary Book
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bats of Saint Abbans is an old-school adventure intended for The Midderlands setting suitable for Levels 1 to 3. The adventure is written for Swords & Wizardry and therefore can be used in all retro-clones and old school role-playing games with little or no work. The book may contain occasional swear words and mature themes.

This 30-page product contains the following :

Church Bats
Mosaic Elementals
Wandering Eyes
Giant Stag Beetles
Blind Ghosts
Candelabran
Church Grims
Star Demons

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Nachmund
boardgame.description:
The Nachmund Gauntlet is a lawless place, home to pirates, heretics, and renegades. These warbands constantly war with each other for territory and wealth, seeking to control one of the few stable passages through the Great Rift. Among the many vying factions in this deadly stretch of space are the Chaos Space Marines and Aeldari Corsairs. Kill teams of these warriors clash in abandoned research posts, hollowed-out asteroid bases, and industrial zones on inhabited worlds, driven as much by long-standing hatreds as a desire for resources. They won’t stop until they claim their prize, or die.

Kill Team: Nachmund is the second full expansion box for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, the ultimate sci-fi skirmish game. It includes miniatures for two complete new Kill Teams - the piratical Aeldari of the Corsair Voidscarred and the sinister superhumans of the Chaos Space Marine Legionaries - as well as double-sided game board, terrain, transfers, and a rules manual featuring missions, background material, and full rosters for these two Kill Teams.

In this box you’ll find:

1x Kill Team Manual
20x Citadel Miniatures
18x Sector Mechanicus Terrain Pieces
1x Double-sided Kill Team

You’ll need a copy of the Kill Team Core Book to make full use of this supplement.

--description from publisher

boardgame.name: Adventure Aid Cards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Bats of Saint Abbans is an old-school adventure intended for The Midderlands setting suitable for Levels 1 to 3. The adventure is written for Swords & Wizardry and therefore can be used in all retro-clones and old school role-playing games with little or no work. The book may contain occasional swear words and mature themes.

This product contains the following pages/cards:

Map of the Town of Saint Abbans
Regional Map of Havenland
Abbey-Cathedral Level 1 - Ground Floor
Abbey-Cathedral Level 2 - Galleries
Abbey-Cathedral Level 3 - Roof-spaces
Abbey-Cathedral Level 4 - Roof
Abbey heights and Section Through Abbey
Abbey-Cathedral Level 5 - Crypts & Cellars + Ye Boke of Belles Handout
The Carillon Cotiliion Handout (3 sections)
NPC and Bestiary Quick Reference Tables
NPC Faces

boardgame.name: Rancid Canyons of the Floating Death Sheep (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yarrowbone is known for its delicious cured and smoked meats. Folk travel for hundreds of miles to sample the delightful tastes and textures of the villager’s meaty products. There’s a problem though. Something is ravaging the livestock populations out in the badlands leaving dismembered and disembowelled sheep out rotting in the midday sun.
Yarrowbone’s leader, Hester Cerese, is worried and the farmers and shepherds are having to graze their flocks elsewhere to keep the dwindling meat supply safe.

Unfortunately, as the herd animals have not been reared and fed on the vegetation found in the badlands, the taste of their meat isn’t the same, and consequently, the locals are getting restless as sales have declined.
Several groups, including an angry mob of locals have gone out to try and hunt whatever is devastating their livestock, but they too have generally ended up as carcasses for the vultures.

Only one person has lived to tell the tale and he refuses to go out there again. Most of the bodies of those villagers killed have been recovered. Two are still missing.
The inhabitants of Yarrowbone are getting desperate and need some hunters and/or heroes to find the missing settlers and save their precipitous meat industry from whatever is destroying it.

Rancid Canyons of the Floating Death Sheep is a low level adventure for Fifth Edition (5E).

The adventure features the following:

The detailed village of Yarrowbone featuring NPCs and 22 locations (can be used as a base for any future adventure).
Immersive NPC and building art.
Six pieces of cool cartography.
Three new juicy magic items.
Seven tricky new adversaries.
Five engaging mapped encounter locations.
Table of additonal adventure hooks.
Table of NPC names.
Information on fitting the adventure into the Lost Wyrld setting of The Midderlands.

boardgame.name: Murder Through Time
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can you survive a murderous 1920s poker tournament? Who killed the passenger on the steam liner to New York in 1947? What happened to the surgeon? And will you be able save your guests from poisoning? Five murder mystery scripts take players to very different places and times in history, from a 1920s birthday party to a modern times charity event, from a steam liner in 1947 to the British coast, where artists and bohemians just discovered: Francis Ford, the famous writer is missing. The scripts include rules and character descriptions, clues and ideas for props, recipes and decorations. They are formatted so that the pages can easily be copied, making it easy to hand over the character descriptions to the individual players.

Some content is 16+.

boardgame.name: Rancid Canyons of the Floating Death Sheep (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yarrowbone is known for its delicious cured and smoked meats. Folk travel for hundreds of miles to sample the delightful tastes and textures of the villager’s meaty products. There’s a problem though. Something is ravaging the livestock populations out in the badlands leaving dismembered and disembowelled sheep out rotting in the midday sun.
Yarrowbone’s leader, Hester Cerese, is worried and the farmers and shepherds are having to graze their flocks elsewhere to keep the dwindling meat supply safe.

Unfortunately, as the herd animals have not been reared and fed on the vegetation found in the badlands, the taste of their meat isn’t the same, and consequently, the locals are getting restless as sales have declined.
Several groups, including an angry mob of locals have gone out to try and hunt whatever is devastating their livestock, but they too have generally ended up as carcasses for the vultures.

Only one person has lived to tell the tale and he refuses to go out there again. Most of the bodies of those villagers killed have been recovered. Two are still missing.
The inhabitants of Yarrowbone are getting desperate and need some hunters and/or heroes to find the missing settlers and save their precipitous meat industry from whatever is destroying it.

Rancid Canyons of the Floating Death Sheep is a low level adventure for Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC).

The adventure features the following.

The detailed village of Yarrowbone featuring NPCs and 22 locations (can be used as a base for any future adventure).
Immersive NPC and building art.
Six pieces of cool cartography.
Three new juicy magic items.
Seven tricky new adversaries.
Five engaging mapped encounter locations.
Table of additonal adventure hooks.
Table of NPC names.
Information on fitting the adventure into the Lost Wyrld setting of The Midderlands.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Rancid Canyons of the Floating Death Sheep (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yarrowbone is known for its delicious cured and smoked meats. Folk travel for hundreds of miles to sample the delightful tastes and textures of the villager’s meaty products. There’s a problem though. Something is ravaging the livestock populations out in the badlands leaving dismembered and disembowelled sheep out rotting in the midday sun.
Yarrowbone’s leader, Hester Cerese, is worried and the farmers and shepherds are having to graze their flocks elsewhere to keep the dwindling meat supply safe.

Unfortunately, as the herd animals have not been reared and fed on the vegetation found in the badlands, the taste of their meat isn’t the same, and consequently, the locals are getting restless as sales have declined.
Several groups, including an angry mob of locals have gone out to try and hunt whatever is devastating their livestock, but they too have generally ended up as carcasses for the vultures.

Only one person has lived to tell the tale and he refuses to go out there again. Most of the bodies of those villagers killed have been recovered. Two are still missing.
The inhabitants of Yarrowbone are getting desperate and need some hunters and/or heroes to find the missing settlers and save their precipitous meat industry from whatever is destroying it.

Rancid Canyons of the Floating Death Sheep is a low level adventure for Swords & Wizardry (S&W).

The adventure features the following.

The detailed village of Yarrowbone featuring NPCs and 22 locations (can be used as a base for any future adventure).
Immersive NPC and building art.
Six pieces of cool cartography.
Three new juicy magic items.
Seven tricky new adversaries.
Five engaging mapped encounter locations.
Table of additonal adventure hooks.
Table of NPC names.
Information on fitting the adventure into the Lost Wyrld setting of The Midderlands.

boardgame.name: Horror Hotel RPG
boardgame.description: Horror Hotel RPG is a printable solo horror RPG wherein the player takes the role of a team of investigators exploring a haunted hotel. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, a deck of poker cards, and two six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Alien Ref - Monsters of Amoverek
boardgame.description: From terrifying xenomorphs to little green Martians to the modern grey aliens, aliens have a way of bring new creatures, new worlds, and the unknown into science fiction, romance, fantasy, and horror games and stories.

boardgame.name: The Triple Serpent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Of old in Ireland, there was the Fianna. A full accounting of the deeds of this band of heroes is too long to write here; be assured they were many and glorious. Every man and woman of the Fianna was supremely skilled in one fashion or another, and all were peerless warriors. They travelled the length and breadth of the island of Ireland, fighting monsters and performing marvellous feats that are still retold in poetry and prose to this day.

All that, though, was long long ago. The time of the Fianna has passed; all but two were slain in the bloody slaughter of the battle of Gabhra, and that was five hundred years ago if it’s a day. Ireland is a holy country now, an island of saints and scholars, converted to the Church by Saint Patrick and his followers. On this isle, the Age of Heroes is passing, and soon all that remains will be the stories recorded by the monks in their great books.

But while Heroes may be fading from Ireland, there are still monsters…

Written by Gareth Ryder-Hanrahan (The One Ring RPG, Dracula Dossiers) and beautifully illustrated by Jon Hodgson (The One Ring RPG, Dungeons and Dragons, Warhammer Historical), and Scott Purdy (Numenera, Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, Pathfinder), is suitable for Heroes of level 5 to 6.

boardgame.name: Intergalactic Bounty RPG
boardgame.description: Intergalactic Bounty RPG is a printable solo sci fi RPG wherein the player takes the role of an intergalactic bounty hunter. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a six-sided die.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Dragon Ref - Monsters of Amoverek
boardgame.description: From dragon slayers to monster hunters to dragon riders and treasure hunters, dragons bring danger, adventure, and thrills into fantasy, romance, and mythological fantasy stories.

boardgame.name: Starbase Adventures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As beings explore the Galaxy, they often build or create waypoints in the form of a starbase, space station, planetary outpost, or the like. These waypoints often act as gathering places for a wider variety of interstellar traveller, and are often magnets for adventure and intrigue. Starfleet officers and other explorers and travellers encounter a wide variety of situations – be they hazardous or benign – while stationed at, or visiting, these types of waypoints.

This packet presents ten detailed mission briefs oriented around a variety of starbase encounters, each of which you can modify for use in your Star Trek Adventures campaigns set during The Next Generation (approximately 2360-2379) or any other era of play with minor modifications. Each mission brief is designed to stand alone, though they could be strung together into a story arc or added to an existing campaign.

boardgame.name: Grammar Fuel: Horror Genre & Subgenres
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grammar Fuel: Horror Genre & Subgenres is an 82-page book of random noun, verb, adjective, and adverb d100 tables each for the Horror genre: horror, weird & cosmic horror, dark fantasy, gothic horror, witch, demon, vampire, ghost, werewolf, mummy, slasher, zombie, and body horror. It is useful to help inspire the creation of fictional stories and games based on random keywords.

boardgame.name: Questors RPG
boardgame.description: Questors RPG is a printable solo fantasy RPG wherein the player takes the role of a deity guiding their chosen adventurer through a series of quests. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and two six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Grammar Fuel: Science Fiction Genre & Subgenres
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Grammar Fuel: Science Fiction Genre & Subgenres is a 81-page book of random noun, verb, adjective, and adverb d100 tables each for the Science Fiction genre: science fiction, space opera, post apocalypse, hard science fiction, space, science, cyberpunk, space war, steampunk, mecha, alien, mutant, and time travel. It is useful to help inspire the creation of fictional stories and games based on random keywords.

boardgame.name: The Flooded Tower
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Prison Deep in the Wilderness
A mysterious flooded tower stands in the lake in the middle of the forest. Legends tell that ancient mages erected it to hide an unspeakable evil and anyone who tries to find it will die a horrible death. Will you be brave enough to uncover its secrets?

The Flooded Tower is a one-shot dungeon crawl for parties at level 4 (or 8) for the 5th and 3.5 editions! Featuring new monsters and a multitude of obstacles for players to overcome, it can be easily dropped in into any wilderness adventure as a point of interest where adventurers can find a treasure - or knowledge - that may aid them in their quest.

Delve into the Flooded Tower, an ancient structure built hundreds of years ago that was said to be a prison for an evil that terrorized the lands around Blackwood forest. Find a way in and fight through three levels of a place that as much as it wants to keep you out wants to keep its prisoner in... and probably for a good reason.

Content
A dungeon crawl ready to be dropped in any wilderness adventure, with several leads
5 new maps (with walls, lights - and all monsters already placed in correct positions in VTT editions) by Meditating Munky!
3 new monsters

boardgame.name: Space Mission RPG
boardgame.description: Space Mission RPG is a printable solo sci fi RPG wherein the player takes the role of a starship crew on a mission to explore outer space. It is played with the rules/character sheet and ten six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Apocalypse Memoria
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Apocalypse Memoria is a solo experience that blends journaling and storytelling games with elements of live-action role-playing. Over the course of several game sessions, you will develop the story of your character while documenting the remnants of the world the character has been left to wander.

You play the game by exploring real-world locations and engaging in real-life activities. Encountering real-world phenomena triggers in-game events that affect your character as well as your ability to accurately document your experience while writing your journal.

Whether you interact with the real-world in character or not is up to you. For example, if you speak to someone in real-life during a mission, it’s up to you to decide whether to have that conversation as yourself or as your character. The fiction of the game allows you to adopt either approach without compromising the experience.

When you finish the game, you will have a unique record of your character’s journey through a fractured future landscape that is a dark mirror of your own journey through the world as it is now.

boardgame.name: Starship Polaris RPG
boardgame.description: Starship Polaris RPG is a printable solo sci fi RPG wherein the player takes the role of a crew of a damaged starship trying to repair their ship and return home. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and two six-sided dice.

boardgame.name: Super Crim RPG
boardgame.description: Super Crim RPG is a printable solo supervillain RPG wherein the player takes the role of a super criminal committing crimes in a corrupted city. It is played with the rules/character sheet, a pencil, and a six-sided die.

boardgame.name: Dub This!
Dub This! | The card game where you can mix and match ANY song!
boardgame.description:
A high-energy, musical party game where you are the DJ!

You be the DJ: after hearing the last word, have your lyrics ready to sing!

Dub or add on to a card or another player after hearing the last word! This means that you mix and match ANY song (sing or rap) using the last word on the card or the last word heard. In the deck are cards with words and phrases to start you off.

You must dub with at least 5 words and then stop at a word that you think the next player(s) will have a hard time adding to.

Other players can challenge your accuracy.

Play to various challenge levels of points or cards remaining.

Beginner Level:

1 minute to dub (think of a new song).
Has extra request lines if you need help.
Winner is first player/team to 30 points.


Medium Level:

Winner is first player/team to 20 points.


Advanced Level:

Winner is first player/team to get rid of all their cards.

boardgame.name: They Came From Beyond the Grave! Quips and Cinematics Cards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They Came from Beyond the Grave! is a dramatic, hammy, and horrifying tabletop roleplaying game encompassing the shock, terror, eroticism, and humor of 1970s horror. This game allows you to play with all the magnificent content from the movies of Hammer, Amicus, and Roger Corman, and promises the fun and thrills of the horror movie genre!

They Came From Beyond the Grave! Quips and Cinematics Cards include more than 120 cards featuring perfect phrases and one-liners to drop in during key moments of play, as well as Cinematic metagame abilities.
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: Heroes in a World of Horror! Quip Cards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They Came from Beyond the Grave! is a dramatic, hammy, and horrifying tabletop roleplaying game encompassing the shock, terror, eroticism, and humor of 1970s horror. This game allows you to play with all the magnificent content from the movies of Hammer, Amicus, and Roger Corman, and promises the fun and thrills of the horror movie genre!

Heroes in a World of Horror! Quips Cards feature perfect phrases and one-liners to drop in during key moments of play.
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: Shapers of Gaia
boardgame.description:
You are a Shaper, emerging from the Vault after millennia carrying the ingredients to restore Gaia and its ecosystem to its former glory! Work alongside the Caretaker robot to earn Prestige as you restore the ruined biomes of the land to their former splendor, repopulate species old and new, and give life to a rejuvenated ecosystem. Accumulate rare resources such as Nutrients and Energy to grow faster. But be careful! New biomes also provide resources to your rival factions.

Shapers use their unique skills to provide different gameplay advantages and challenges. There are six Shapers to choose from.

Use your unique abilities to come out on top as you compete with the other Shapers for resources and Prestige. Gain Prestige by arranging animals following their established behaviors, collecting DNA samples, and unlocking new Shaper abilities. Only the Shaper with the most Prestige (VP) at the end of the game will be allowed to permanently join the Caretaker as guardians of the rebirthed Gaia!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Tech Revolution
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Command the galaxy's cutting-edge technologies so sophisticated that they rival magic itself! Outfit yourself with the latest and greatest new weapons, armor, and other gear, from high-power explosives to alien relics that surpass conventional science. Or incorporate technologies directly into yourself, whether you're installing advanced cybernetic augmentations or playing Starfinder's newest class: the nanocyte, whose body hosts an army of robotic nanites that obey her commands!

Outrace the speediest threats by customizing your own space-age vehicles, and overcome even the toughest foes by piloting powerful battle robots using the all-new mech combat system! Seize the future with additional options for every class and articles exploring every aspect of science-fantasy tech from advertising and music to virtual intelligences and security systems. Join in the Starfinder Tech Revolution!

boardgame.name: The Well of Bones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings, weary traveller. I am Dr Krowe, your humble guide to The Coiled Crown, an expanding line of system-agnostic supplements from Rookery Publications.

Join me as we take a tour of a glorious crypt unlike any other. But be careful. No matter how things appear, its bone-lined halls are not empty. Something stirs within the Well of Bones…

…The Well of Bones includes:


A 21-page Location. A richly detailed, wonderfully creepy ossuary that can be added to any settlement in your setting of choice.
An In-depth History. An overview of the Well's history, from its horrific founding to the present day.
A Detailed Description. A breakdown of the Well's interior with two keyed maps, taking you from the ceremonial galleries above down to the dark well below.
The Sorrowers. An examination of the Sorrowful Order of the Grateful Dead, the order of morticians that inhabits the well. The Sorrowful order can be used to add a fresh perspective to the death practices in your game, with poems, NPC descriptions, 'Veils of Tears', and even suggestions for how to include PC Sorrowers in your setting.
Adventure Hooks. 6 adventure hooks exploring the darkest secrets of the Well, ensuring the location can be incorporated into your games with ease and revisited many times.


NEW CONTENT! 13th January, 2022


Two Map Packs. Two 5-page map packs containing all the Well's glorious maps at a high resolution, both with and without labels. The first pack contains the original, unedited maps. The second pack contains printer-friendly versions.


MORE NEW CONTENT! 26th January, 2022


Deeper Into the Well of Bones. A 5-page booklet offering a further 10 Adventure Hooks for use in The Well of Bones, and suggestions for how to combine these to create your own mini-campaigns!

boardgame.name: Jordenheim: the core rule book
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Inside these pages, you will discover a Viking-themed universe of myth and magic. Create compelling characters in this detailed yet easy-to-play original tabletop RPG. The Vikings of Jordenheim have coexisted with the creatures of the magical realm of The Shroud for a thousand years. Now, the new religion of Khristianity threatens the supremacy of the Elder Gods. Within this standalone reference book, you will find both the setting and the ruleset, and is everything you need to start playing the heroes destined to become legends.

boardgame.name: Tile Bridge
boardgame.description:
A board game very much based on Bridge, the card game with 4 players, two per side but instead of cards there are 52 tiles, a rack for each player and a felt play mat.
The tiles are shuffled and randomly dealt face down, 13 to each player.
Bidding takes place as per Bridge and the hand opposite the final declarer is revealed.

Possession of a pencil/pen and a bridge score pad is advised as they are not included in the box.

boardgame.name: Nightfell: Bestiario
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Il mondo di Iùrmen è popolato da creature spaventose e orrori indicibili.
Scoprirai leggende e folklore legati ai mostri che traggono forza dalla Notte Eterna.

English translation:
The world of Irmen is populated by frightening creatures and unspeakable horrors.
You will discover legends and folklore related to the monsters that draw strength from the Eternal Night.

boardgame.name: Articulate!: New Zealand Edition
boardgame.description:
You all know Articulate, the fast-talking description game, now get ready for the New Zealand Edition! With adapted playing cards, including Kiwi towns, wildlife and celebrities, this is the ultimate local gaming experience!

Try to get your partner to say as many words from a particular category written on the cards within the thirty second time limit, you may only pass once. Move your team pawn forward a number of spaces on the board equal to the number of words you got correct.

If you land on an Orange or Red space, spin the spinner for a chance to move yourself 2 or 3 spaces forward, or move an opponent piece 2 or 3 spaces back. If you land on a spade space, try to get you team mate to say the word on the card before any other team can say it. Whoever answers correctly gets a turn immediately.

Categories include Person, World, Object, Action, Nature and Random. First team to make it around the board and successfully answer a spade category (chosen from any of the above) wins the game.

boardgame.name: Nightfell: Libro delle Avventure
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Svela i segreti delle terre ghiacciate di Alper e affronta un nuovo culto di vampiri che minaccia le lande settentrionali.
Indaga sui misteri di Roccia del Gufo e sulla scomparsa di un villaggio maledetto dalle streghe.
Immergiti in una guerra civile per la salvezza della Città Bianca, mentre antichi orrori riemergono dalle profondità della montagna.

English translation:
Uncover the secrets of Alper's frozen lands and face a new vampire cult that threatens the northern lands.
Investigate the mysteries of Owl Rock and the disappearance of a village cursed by witches.
Immerse yourself in a civil war for the salvation of the White City as ancient horrors resurface from the depths of the mountain.

boardgame.name: Nightfell: Schermo del Night Master
boardgame.description:
User summari:
DM's screen

boardgame.name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel Crossover Vol. 4, Issue 11
boardgame.description:
Fine-tune your decks with the latest mechanics and put your favorite Super Heroes and Super Villains to the test at all-new Locations!

This Issue will expand on teams from previous sets, including Spider-Friends, The Utopia Battles, and Monsters Unleashed!
Play as 2 new Main Characters and 9 new Supporting Characters!
New Terrain, Battleworld Locations, and Boss Battles cards.

Contains 55 playable cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – The Civil War Battles

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Innistrad: Midnight Hunt
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering returns to the gothic horror world of Innistrad. Since we last visited Innistrad in Eldritch Moon, Emrakul's lingering presence has been causing the days to become shorter and shorter, and if nothing is done to stop it, an eternal night will soon fall across the land, leaving nothing to stop the werewolves and vampires from overrunning what's left of humanity. At the Harvesttide Festival, a group of witches has gathered all the defenders of the day together at the Celestus for a last-ditch ritual to bring back the sun—but the werewolf leader Tovolar and his Dire Pack are ready to lay siege to the festival to stop them.

Innistrad: Midnight Hunt features the return of the ghosts, zombies, vampires, werewolves, and humans of previous Innistrad sets, but with a special spotlight on werewolves. The set contains more werewolves than any other expansion in Magic history, and all of the werewolves (as well as the witches) have a special alt-art "equinox" showcase version that appears about half as often as the normal version. The flagship mechanic is Day and Night, a revamp of the original werewolf mechanic from Innistrad. Other new mechanics include Disturb, Decayed, and Coven.

The set contains 277 cards (100 commons, 83 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 10 full-art "Eternal Night" basic lands) and is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles. Two tie-in Commander decks were also released alongside the main set: Coven Counters, a green-white deck themed around the Coven mechanic, and Undead Unleashed, a blue-black zombie deck based on the Decayed mechanic.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Magic: The Gathering — Innistrad: Double Feature

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms
Magic: The Gathering — Adventures in the Forgotten Realms Commander: Aura of Courage
Magic: The Gathering — Adventures in the Forgotten Realms Commander: Draconic Rage
Magic: The Gathering — Adventures in the Forgotten Realms Commander: Dungeons of Death
Magic: The Gathering — Adventures in the Forgotten Realms Commander: Planar Portal
boardgame.description:
This is the very first Magic: The Gathering expansion to cross over with Dungeons & Dragons!

Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms takes place, as the name suggests, in the Forgotten Realms, bringing the setting's wealth of lore and characters to Magic. The set is designed to evoke the feeling of D&D. New mechanics include dungeons that you can venture into (including Dungeon of the Mad Mage, Lost Mine of Phandelver, and Tomb of Annihilation), classes that you can level up in (including all twelve classes from the Player's Handbook), and twenty-sided dice. Special showcase frames evoke classic D&D module covers and monster entries. Many of the spells have names like "You're Ambushed on the Road" and "You Come to a River" and offer you a choice of what to do. Even the basic lands have flavor text providing a small adventure hook.

The set contains 281 cards and is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles. Four preconstructed Commander decks were also released alongside the main set as tie-ins.
